terrier

Class DJM

  • java.lang.Object
    • terrier.DJM

  • public class DJM
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for Dirichlet Jelinek-Mercer two-phase language model smoothing By default JM smoothing is deactivated. In order to turn it on, simply set lambda using the setLambda method to a value between bigger than 0 and smaller than 0. Setting this variable to 0 again will shut JM off. If you want shut down Dirichlet smoothing, use setMu to set this constant to 0.
    Author:
    Luiz Felix

      • queryCorpus

        public org.terrier.querying.Request queryCorpus(java.lang.String query,
                                                org.terrier.structures.Index index)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Perform a query on the corpus using the DJM method.
        Parameters:
        query - The already prepared query (expanded, stopped, stemmed, lower cased containning only unique terms)
        index - The Terrier index.
        Returns:
        A request containing the query results.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there's any I/O fault while reading the index.

      • performQueries

        public void performQueries(java.lang.String outputFile,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> queries,
                           org.terrier.structures.Index index,
                           StagedQueryExpansion queryExpansionPipeline,
                           boolean useDocnoAsMeta,
                           boolean CHVOnly)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Performs a set of queries, stored in a HashMap pair on the corpus. After each query is performed, its result is stored on outputFile path.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - The complete file path to where to write the file with the queries result.
        queries - Contains the queries on pairs . The queries must be space-separated and Stopwords and Porter-Stemmer is performed over them before issuing them to Terrier.
        index - The Terrier index file
        StagedQueryExpansion - An object to the class used to perform query expansion. If this object is null, then no query expansion is performed
        useDocnoAsMeta - if this parameter is set to true, then the document identification used on output is its filename, otherwise it's the document's number
        CHVOnly - if true only CHV query expansion is performed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an IO fault happens

      • writeExpandedQueries

        public void writeExpandedQueries(java.lang.String outputFile,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> queries,
                                 org.terrier.structures.Index index,
                                 StagedQueryExpansion queryExpansionPipeline,
                                 boolean CHVOnly)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Just expands the query terms and writes into a new SingleLineTRECQUery formated file.
        Parameters:
        outputFile - The path to the new file to be created.
        queries - A Map containing queryID -> queryText. The IDs are preserved on the new file.
        index - The Terrier index object.
        queryExpansionPipeline - The query expansion strategy, that must correspond to a class implementing PipelineInterfae
        CHVOnly - if true only CHV query expansion is performed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If there's an I/O fault either while expanding the query or writing the new file to disk.

      • getMu

        public double getMu()
        Returns:
        Returns the current value of mu.

      • setMu

        public void setMu(double mu)
        Update the value of mu used on DJM method. If mu < 0, the previous value is kept.
        Parameters:
        mu - The new value of mu. It must be greater or equals than 0.

      • getLambda

        public double getLambda()
        Returns:
        Returns the current value of lambda.

      • setLambda

        public void setLambda(double lambda)
        Update the value of lambda used on DJM method. If lambda < 0, the previous value is kept.
        Parameters:
        lambda - The new value of lambda. It must be greater or equals than 0.

      • getAmountOfRetrievedDocuments

        public int getAmountOfRetrievedDocuments()
        Returns:
        Retuns the amount of retrieved documents when a query is performed

      • setAmountOfRetrievedDocuments

        public void setAmountOfRetrievedDocuments(int newAmount)
        Parameters:
        newAmount - The new amount of retrieved documents when a query is performed. The default value is 1000. If this value is lesser than 0, this method has no effect.
